source.name: Merkle Tree 03
source.instructions: True or False: Merkle Trees store the entire blockchain data.
source.guidance: The statement is false. Merkle Trees do not store the entire blockchain data. Instead, they store summary information about the data in the form of cryptographic hashes. This allows for efficient verification of large datasets without storing all the data. Merkle Trees are used to summarize and verify the integrity of data blocks, not to store the entire blockchain.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify a key characteristic of Merkle Trees in relation to blockchain technology
